body_html:
ok, then your targets are Long and you shouldn't do target_variable.float().

Try

loss = criterion(model_prediction.float(), target_variable)

There is a DoubleTensor produced somewhere in your code where a FloatTensor is expected. Maybe in EncoderRNN, maybe some numpy -> pytorch conversion done with a numpy.float64 array

body:
ok, then your targets are Long and you shouldn't do target_variable.float().

Try

```
loss = criterion(model_prediction.float(), target_variable)
```

There is a DoubleTensor produced somewhere in your code where a FloatTensor is expected. Maybe in EncoderRNN, maybe some numpy -> pytorch conversion done with a numpy.float64 array
